title: Sakuragawa Apartment Renovation / Osaka Design Department
description: This renovation project reimagines a 60-square-meter apartment by maximizing visual and spatial fluidity while carefully designing light and shadow to enhance depth, openness, and a three-dimensional spatial experience. Despite its compact footprint, the apartment unfolds with a richness of perception and movement, orchestrated through shifting sightlines, varied floor levels, and nuanced material transitions. The generous ceiling height and a private roof terrace serve as key spatial assets, enabling a layout that encourages both fluid circulation and moments of calm, shared intimacy.
author: Miwa Negoro

title: Baltycki Apartments / Maxberg
description: Creating development near the shoreline is a particularly difficult and responsible task. Pressure from investors, for whom a large and distinctive building is to their liking, not infrequently results in oversized buildings. In the case of Apartamenty Bałtycki, the overriding goal of the project was to dialogue with both the architecture of the characteristic pre-war villas of Swinoujscie and the landscape of the coastal dune where the development was located.
author: Andreas Luco

title: Prefab, But Make It Joyful: Inside a Colorful Modular Escape
description: In the green hills of Ibiúna, a quiet rural town about 90 minutes from São Paulo, architect Rodrigo Ohtake has built a family retreat unlike any other. Designed for weekends away with his wife Ana Carolina and their three children, the home is both a restful hideaway and a bold experiment in modular, eco-conscious design. The result? A prefabricated house that feels anything but prefabricated, joyful, fluid, and in sync with nature.
author: Erin

title: Inside a Houseboat That Feels Like a Home
description: Blatto Boat is a newly constructed Floating On Water Residence (FOWR) located on the north end of Seattle’s Lake Union. Designed by Seattle studio GO'C, the houseboat is built within the exact footprint of an existing 12-by-40-foot vessel, making efficient use of every available inch.
author: Erin

title: The YMK Residence Brings Layered Living to the Karuizawa Highlands
description: Takeshi Hirobe Architects designs the YMK house in Karuizawa, Japan across six levels that follow its dramatically sloped, rural highland site.

title: A Maui Home Blends Modern Minimalism With Climate-Conscious Design
